question: A queue follows the Last In, First Out (LIFO) principle.
In an array-based queue, the front pointer points to the first element in the queue.
A linked list implementation of a queue requires a fixed size.
The enqueue operation adds an element to the rear of the queue.
A queue is an example of an Abstract Data Type (ADT).
In a queue, elements are removed from the rear.
A circular queue helps to efficiently utilize memory by reusing empty spaces.
In a linked list-based queue, each node contains data and a pointer to the next node.
The ‘isFull()’ operation is used in both array and linked list implementations of a queue.
Queues are commonly used in process scheduling and task management.
